p: The main localization in the acute phase of the disease is the pulmonary alveoli and, more specifically, the pneumocytes within them. The “cytokine storm” accompanies the response to pneumocyte aggression. In addition to this, pulmonary embolisms related to coagulation disorders must be added. It is very likely that sequelae will persist in the form of pulmonary fibrosis with its usual complications of superinfection and hypoxia leading to respiratory and cardiac insufficiency.
